clinical_study.brief_title: Environmental Surveillance (ES) for Polio and AMR Using the TaqMan Array Card
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of TaqMan Array Card for Environmental Surveillance of Polio Virus and Antimicrobial Resistance Genes

collaborator.agency: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be used to develop a tool to streamline poliovirus environmental surveillance for the polio endgame and to provide a tool for detecting polio in places where there is no capacity to carry out the gold standard culture-based detection.

detailed_description.textblock: This environmental surveillance tool will also include antimicrobial resistance (AMR) genes to describe resistome profile in environmental samples and to better inform us of the potential risks of exposure to these environments

primary_outcome.measure: Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) detection of poliovirus, enteric pathogens and antimicrobial resistance genes from environmental samples
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate performance of the TaqMan Array Card (TAC) on environmental samples (sewage samples) collected in urban slum area of Mirpur. The primary purpose will be to use TAC to detect and monitor Sabin 1 and 3 polio viruses post SIA.

study_pop.textblock: The investigators will conduct a Supplementary Immunization Activity (SIA) using bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV) and administer bOPV to at least 70% of all children under the age of 5 in the participating wards in the urban slums of Mirpur, Dhaka

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- birth-4 years of age
- reside in selected urban slums of Mirpur Dhaka, Bangladesh
- receiving bOPV immunization
Exclusion Criteria:
- parent unwilling to consent

facility.name: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research
